SEARCH
Package it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest

Class GameSettingsPostRR

java.lang.Object
it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest.AbstractRR
it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest.GameSettingsPostRR
All Implemented Interfaces:
RestResource
public class GameSettingsPostRR extends AbstractRR
Handles the POST request for /game/settings. Get the game setting, i.e., the players and the number of roles, check if they are correct, and if so, create the game.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
LupusInFabula Group

    • doServe

      protected void doServe() throws IOException
      Description copied from class: AbstractRR

      Subclasses have to implement this method in order to define the actual strategy for serving the REST request.

      Specified by:
      doServe in class AbstractRR
      Throws:
      IOException - if any error occurs in the client/server communication.

    • isValidRole

      private boolean isValidRole(List<Role> roles, String roleToCheck)
      Verify if the passed role is valid, i.e., if it exists in the game
      Parameters:
      roles - list of all the roles
      roleToCheck - role to check
      Returns:
      true if the role exists, false otherwise

    • isValidRolesCardinality

      private boolean isValidRolesCardinality(Map<String,Integer> selectedRoles, List<Role> roles)
      This function verifies that the number of roles chosen meets certain prerequisites:
      Parameters:
      selectedRoles - Map with the roles and the selected cardinality
      roles - List with all the roles
      Returns:
      True if all prerequisites have been satisfied; otherwise, false.
      Possible cases for returning false include:
      • Invalid role cardinality, i.e., the cardinality must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to the maximum cardinality allowed for the role.
      • When the maximum count of good roles exceeds three-quarters of the total number of roles.
      • When the maximum count of evil roles exceeds one-quarter of the total number of roles.
      • When the minimum count of evil roles falls below one-eighth of the total number of roles.

    • randomRole

      private String randomRole(Map<String,Integer> roles)
      Selects a random role from the available roles.
      Parameters:
      roles - A map containing available roles and their counts.
      Returns:
      A randomly selected role.
